co.cask.coopr.scheduler.callback
Interface ClusterCallback

All Known Implementing Classes:
HttpPostClusterCallback
public interface ClusterCallback

Executes some code before a job starts and after a job completes. Callbacks must be idempotent. There is a possibility they get called more than once if the server goes down at the right time.

Method Summary
 void initialize(Configuration conf)
          Initialize the cluster callback.
 void onFailure(CallbackData data, CallbackContext context)
          Execute some method after a cluster job fails.
 boolean onStart(CallbackData data, CallbackContext context)
          Execute some method before a cluster job starts, returning whether or not the job can proceed or whether it should be failed.
 void onSuccess(CallbackData data, CallbackContext context)
          Execute some method after a cluster completes successfully.
 

Method Detail

initialize

void initialize(Configuration conf)
Initialize the cluster callback. Guaranteed to be called exactly once before any other methods are called.

Parameters:
conf - Server configuration.

onStart

boolean onStart(CallbackData data,
                CallbackContext context)
Execute some method before a cluster job starts, returning whether or not the job can proceed or whether it should be failed. Is guaranteed to be called and executed before the cluster operation begins.

Parameters:
data - Data available to use while executing callback.
Returns:
True if it is ok to proceed with the operation, false if not.

onSuccess

void onSuccess(CallbackData data,
               CallbackContext context)
Execute some method after a cluster completes successfully.

Parameters:
data - Data available to use while executing callback.

onFailure

void onFailure(CallbackData data,
               CallbackContext context)
Execute some method after a cluster job fails.

Parameters:
data - Data available to use while executing callback.
